name: That's Why
author: Astronatic

sections.description:
With this plugin you can add your That’s Why snippet to your WordPress site.

This plugin adds the That’s Why Real User Monitoring service to your website. It uses an external service to collect, process, and monitor user experiences of your website visitors. This is done by including a JavaScript-snippet to your website via our Content Delivery Network (via the domain *.thatswhy.app) or your custom domain. You will need an active account on That’s Why to use this plugin.

For more information about which data That’s Why is processing, you can take a look at this Terms of Service & Privacy Policy.
sections.installation:
1. A: In your WordPress admin panel, go to Plugins > New Plugin, search for That’s Why and click “Install now”
    B: Alternatively, download the plugin and upload the contents of thatswhy-app.zip to your plugins directory, which usually is /wp-content/plugins/.
  2. Activate the plugin
sections.changelog:
1.0.0 – December 31, 2020

First release of the That’s Why for WordPress plugin.

short_description: An easy way to implement the That's Why Real User Monitoring snippet to your Wordpress sites.
description:
With this plugin you can add your That’s Why snippet to your WordPress site.

This plugin adds the That’s Why Real User Monitoring service to your website. It uses an external service to collect, process, and monitor user experiences of your website visitors. This is done by including a JavaScript-snippet to your website via our Content Delivery Network (via the domain *.thatswhy.app) or your custom domain. You will need an active account on That’s Why to use this plugin.

For more information about which data That’s Why is processing, you can take a look at this Terms of Service & Privacy Policy.

screenshots.caption: Monitor the performance and user experience of your actual visitors.
Track useful metrics like the Core Web Vitals, page breakdown times, and loading times.
Collect and see performance data from your actual visitors across the whole world.
Gain insight into the performance of specific pages and optimize where needed.
Setting up is easy; simply add the Site Hash in the WordPress admin panel and you're good to go.
